page.title: 01Unapool, Kylesku, Kylestrome
page.content: Mountains, glens, lochs, deserted roads, days when darkness falls by 4 p.m._ that is Winter. Busy roads, lots of people of different nationalities, very few hours of darkness _ that is Summer. Situated in North West Sutherland, separated by the sea loch, Loch a' Chairn Bhain,are the commmunities of {UNAPOOL}_a small crofting township; population 6 adults and 3 children, {KYLESKU}_a hamlet containing a hotel and eight houses, population 18 adults and 8 children,{KYLESTROME}_a private sporting estate, on the north side of the loch population 18 adults and 2 children. Unapool and Kylesku have always been closely integrated while social links with Kylestrome were dependent on the Ferry. Since the KYLESKU BRIDGE opened in 1984 we are one community.
